intro: Horkelia rydbergii, commonly known as the Rydberg's horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, gray-green leaves. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or arid environments. Horkelia rydbergii is adapted to harsh conditions and is an important part of its native ecosystem.
